critique: The executive order seems to be a formal document outlining regulations for Non-Necessity Certificates related to emergency facilities during a national defense emergency. It defines terms, specifies procedures, and designates authority. The intended audience is likely government agencies, legal professionals, and businesses involved in emergency facilities. The order aims to provide clarity and structure for the process of determining when an emergency facility is no longer necessary for national defense. It does not seem to evoke strong emotions. Surprise is possible as the order was created during world war II, and any new order could have been surprising.
